Sentence: Large bulks of RE-Ba-Cu-O (REBCO, RE denotes rare Earth elements) high-temperature superconductors have been reported to trap a stable magnetic field as high as 17 T at 29 K between two 26.5 mm YBCO bulks [1] and 17.6 T at 26 K between two 25 mm GdBCO/Ag bulks [2], meanwhile the recorded high trapped magnetic field at liquid nitrogen (77 K) reaches 1.6 T for 33 mm YBCO/Ag bulk [3] and 3.05 T for 65 mm GdBCO/Ag bulk , which has shown significant potential of bulk superconductors for engineering permanent magnet applications such as superconducting magnetic bear- ings and flywheel energy storage systems , due to their distinguished abilities of high critical temperature (T c ), auto- stable levitation performance and trapping larger magnetic field at boiling point of liquid nitrogen (77 K) than iron-based permanent magnets.
